Just to follow up on this discussion, with the July 2025 Refresh [media libraries have been sunset](https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-refresh-july-24-2025#media-libraries-sunset-and-built-in-migrations) and we've shipped [built-in migration support](https://docs.kentico.com/guides/architecture/media-libraries-migration-guidance).
If you look at the product roadmap you can see some upcoming features make the Content hub an even more compelling DAM, like:
* [AIRA content item language translations](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/93-ai-translations-1-generate-content-item-language-variant-using-aira)
* [AIRA cascade translations of linked content items](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/341-ai-translations-3-generate-language-variants-including-linked-content-using-aira)
* [Recycle bin](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/341-ai-translations-3-generate-language-variants-including-linked-content-using-aira) and [content locking](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/167-content-locking) for content items * [Invariant (culture independent) fields](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/310-invariant-fields) for content items
